channel.title: PI : CombatAssistant : how much the player got for?
channel.description:
Is there an int that expresses how much the player got for [b]from an NPC?[/b] I'm writing vengeance against npc's , the main setup has been done , but when the npc hits me it wont deal vengeance.
Instead , it will hit what i hit the npc x 0.75 for example : if i hit 40 and i have veng on , i will hit an additional 30. (that's what i don't want ofcourse <.<)

item.title: PI : CombatAssistant : how much the player got for?
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

Cres, that does look correct.

Read full topic

item.title: PI : CombatAssistant : how much the player got for?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

ranger squad:

Search for something along the lines of player.inflictDamage(damageAmt) (I’m using completely generic method names, but you see what I mean), and change the code around that accordingly.

I’ve tried that , i’ve tried using hitDiff and hitDiff2 which are both used on the hitsplashes ( they represent how much the player got hit for , or the npc ) but that didn’t work , otherwise i will try to declare a new int and define the dmg to the player.

Also , is it possible to use an int from NPCHandler?
because i’ve found one named damage and at the end of that method it says
PlayerHP -= damage; ( also generic code )

Read full topic
